Package view

Interface TextView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IOManagerTextView
    public interface TextView
    The interface for a client's perspective of the model of Bodega Dreams.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void display​(java.lang.String message)
      Renders a given message to the data output in the implementation.
      void displayActiveParty()
      Renders every Character found in the Manager's active party.
      void displayAllCharacters()
      Renders every Character that the Manager contains.
      void displayAllParties()
      Renders every Party that the Manager contains.
      void displayCharacter​(java.lang.String name)
      Renders the stats of a specified character found in the Manager.
      void displayManagerRules()
      Renders a message listing out all the rules that this TextView's Manager abides by.
      void displayParty​(java.lang.String name)
      Renders every Character found in Party with the given name.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        void display​(java.lang.String message)
      throws java.io.IOException,
             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Renders a given message to the data output in the implementation.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the given message is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • displayManagerRules

        void displayManagerRules()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Renders a message listing out all the rules that this TextView's Manager abides by. This can include listing out the stats that Character's use, if they have roles or not, etc.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails

      • displayAllCharacters

        void displayAllCharacters()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Renders every Character that the Manager contains. This includes just their name and the player's name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no characters

      • displayAllParties

        void displayAllParties()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Renders every Party that the Manager contains. This includes the name of the Partys and the names and player names of the Characters in them.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no parties

      • displayCharacter

        void displayCharacter​(java.lang.String name)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Renders the stats of a specified character found in the Manager. This method renders the character's name, player name, the class (if applicable), class specification (if applicable), health points, and the name of each stat and their values.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the character to display
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there's no character with the given name in the manager. OR if the given String is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no characters

      • displayParty

        void displayParty​(java.lang.String name)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Renders every Character found in Party with the given name. This method renders each character the same way that displayCharacter() does.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Party to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there's no party with the given name in the manager. OR if the given String is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no parties

      • displayActiveParty

        void displayActiveParty()
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Renders every Character found in the Manager's active party. This method renders each character the same way that displaysStatsOf() does.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission of the message to the data output fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the manager has no parties
